Text: Bless the LORD, O my soul, and all that is within me, bless His holy name.
Context: The psalmist is calling upon his soul to praise the LORD with deep reverence and devotion for His holiness.

Text: Bless the LORD, O my soul, and forget not all His benefits—
Context: The psalmist continues to exhort himself to remember the manifold blessings and benefits that come from the LORD.

Text: who forgives all your iniquities, who heals all your diseases,
Context: The verse expresses gratitude for the LORD’s forgiveness and healing, acknowledging His compassion and care.

Text: who redeems your life from the Pit, who crowns you with loving devotion and tender mercies,
Context: The psalmist appreciates the LORD‘s salvation and his restoration, recognizing the LORD’s love and mercy in his life.

Text: who satisfies you with good things, so that your youth is renewed like the eagle‘s.
Context: A feeling of contentment is expressed, as the LORD provides abundantly, resulting in renewed strength and vigor.

Text: The LORD executes righteousness and justice for all the oppressed.
Context: The psalmist approves of the LORD’s character; He is just and righteous, especially on behalf of those who are oppressed.

Text: He made known His ways to Moses, His deeds to the people of Israel—
Context: The verse reflects on the historical revelation of God‘s ways to Moses and His mighty deeds to Israel, emphasizing the LORD’s willingness to reveal Himself.

Text: The LORD is compassionate and gracious, slow to anger, abounding in loving devotion.
Context: It presents the LORD‘s attributes, expressing relief and comfort in His patience and abundant love.

Text: He will not always accuse, nor harbor His anger forever.
Context: Comfort in knowing that the LORD’s anger is not perpetual and that He does not hold onto accusations.

Text: He has not dealt with us according to our sins, nor repaid us according to our iniquities.
Context: A sense of gratitude is present, as God‘s response is merciful rather than giving us what our sins deserve.

Text: For as high as the heavens are above the earth, so great is His loving devotion for those who fear Him;
Context: The psalmist is in awe of the vast love the LORD has for those who revere Him, making a comparison to the great distance between earth and heaven.

Text: As far as the east is from the west, so far has He removed our transgressions from us.
Context: Reassures of God’s complete removal of our sins, using the infinite distance between east and west as a metaphor.

Text: As a father has compassion on his children, so the LORD has compassion on those who fear Him.
Context: This verse depicts the LORD‘s compassion with the tenderness of a father’s love towards his children, for those who hold Him in reverence.

Text: For He knows how we are formed, He remembers that we are dust.
Context: The verse shows God‘s understanding of human frailty, recognizing our mortal nature.

Text: As for man, his days are like grass; he flourishes like a flower of the field;
Context: The impermanence of human life is reflected upon, likened to the brief lifespan of grass and flowers.

Text: for when the wind passes over, it vanishes, and its place remembers it no more.
Context: Acceptance of the transience of life; just as wind sweeps away a flower and it’s gone without a trace.

Text: But from everlasting to everlasting, the LORD‘s loving devotion is with those who fear Him, and His righteousness with their children’s children—
Context: The eternity of God‘s love is emphasized, giving encouragement that it extends from generation to generation.

Text: —with those who keep His covenant and remember to obey His precepts.
Context: Declaration of respect for those who are faithful to God’s covenant and obedient to His commands.

Text: The LORD has established His throne in heaven, and His kingdom rules over all.
Context: Admiration for God‘s sovereign rule over the universe, with His throne signifying His authority over all creation.

Text: Bless the LORD, all His angels mighty in power, who perform His word, obeying the voice of His word.
Context: Call for the angels, recognized for their strength and obedience, to praise the LORD.

Text: Bless the LORD, all His heavenly hosts, you His servants who do His will.
Context: Joyful exhortation for all the inhabitants of heaven to bless and praise the LORD.

Text: Bless the LORD, all His works in all places of His dominion. Bless the LORD, O my soul!
Context: A final call to every part of creation to offer praise to the LORD, ending with a personal declaration of praise from the psalmist’s soul.
